typeSystemDescription.name: org.apache.ctakes.typesystem.types.TypeSystem
typeSystemDescription.description: This is a Apache cTAKES Common Type System for clinical NLP. It includes general types necessary to store annotations and interface with clinical element models

typeDescription.name: org.apache.ctakes.typesystem.type.syntax.WordToken
typeDescription.description: Differentiates a token as being a word rather than a punctuation, symbol, newline, contraction, or number. Equivalent to cTAKES: edu.mayo.bmi.uima.core.type.WordToken

typeDescription.name: org.apache.ctakes.typesystem.type.syntax.BaseToken
typeDescription.description: A supertype for tokens subsuming word, punctuation, symbol, newline, contraction, or number. Includes parts of speech, which are grammatical categories, e.g., noun (NN) or preposition (IN) that use Penn Treebank tags with a few additions. Equivalent to cTAKES: edu.mayo.bmi.uima.core.type.BaseToken

typeDescription.name: org.apache.ctakes.typesystem.type.syntax.ContractionToken
typeDescription.description: Differentiates a token as being a contraction rather than a punctuation, symbol, newline, word, or number. Equivalent to cTAKES: edu.mayo.bmi.uima.core.type.ContractionToken

typeDescription.name: org.apache.ctakes.typesystem.type.structured.DocumentID
typeDescription.description: Equivalent to cTAKES: org.apache.ctakes.typesystem.type.DocumentID, but its supertype changed to uima.cas.TOP

typeDescription.name: org.apache.ctakes.typesystem.type.structured.DocumentIdPrefix
typeDescription.description: Can specify a prefix to a document ID. Useful for directory tree retention.

typeDescription.name: org.apache.ctakes.typesystem.type.structured.DocumentPath
typeDescription.description: Can specify the full path to a document source. Useful for directory retention.

typeDescription.name: org.apache.ctakes.typesystem.type.syntax.Lemma
typeDescription.description: Stores a lemma (canonical form of a token). Inherits from uima.cas.TOP, allowing for reuse of standardized forms across the CAS. Equivalent to cTAKES: edu.mayo.bmi.uima.core.type.Lemma

typeDescription.name: org.apache.ctakes.typesystem.type.syntax.NewlineToken
typeDescription.description: Differentiates a token as being a newline rather than a punctuation, symbol, contraction, word, or number. Equivalent to cTAKES: edu.mayo.bmi.uima.core.type.NewlineToken

typeDescription.name: org.apache.ctakes.typesystem.type.syntax.NumToken
typeDescription.description: Differentiates a token as being a number rather than a punctuation, symbol, newline, word, or contraction. Equivalent to cTAKES: edu.mayo.bmi.uima.core.type.NumToken

typeDescription.name: org.apache.ctakes.typesystem.type.refsem.OntologyConcept
typeDescription.description: Ontologies (e.g., SNOMED-CT) provide an expert semantic representation for concepts. They typically assign a code to a concept and normalize across various textual representations of that concept. IdentifiedAnnotation and Elements may point to these normalized concept representations to indicate clinical concepts. Equivalent to cTAKES: edu.mayo.bmi.uima.core.type.OntologyConcept

featureDescription.name: oui
featureDescription.description: holds the rxnorm unique identifier for a given drug mention. TODO: change this attribute because of name clash (UMLS/SNOMED)

featureDescription.name: score
featureDescription.description: Word Sense disambiguation: if this named entity is assigned multiple ontologyConcepts, the score represents how similar this sense is to surrounding senses (higher scores = more likely to be the correct sense)

featureDescription.name: disambiguated
featureDescription.description: Word Sense disambiguation: if this named entity is assigned multiple ontologyConcepts, then the OntologyConcept with disambiguated=true is the most likely sense

typeDescription.name: org.apache.ctakes.typesystem.type.syntax.PunctuationToken
typeDescription.description: Differentiates a token as being punctuation rather than a contraction, symbol, newline, word, or number. Equivalent to cTAKES: edu.mayo.bmi.uima.core.type.PunctuationToken

typeDescription.name: org.apache.ctakes.typesystem.type.textspan.Segment
typeDescription.description: A section of a clinical text, e.g., Diagnosis, Current Medications, Problem List. Different segments often have differing sublanguages and clinical relevance. Equivalent to cTAKES: edu.mayo.bmi.uima.core.type.Segment

featureDescription.name: preferredText
featureDescription.description: preferredText is the normalized/resolved section name. Normally, this is populated by the Sectionizer and would contain the HL7/CCDA section name.

typeDescription.name: org.apache.ctakes.typesystem.type.textspan.Sentence
typeDescription.description: Sentences may or may not be fully-formed and grammatical. They form the unit of analysis for some downstream components (e.g., constituency parsers). Equivalent to cTAKES: edu.mayo.bmi.uima.core.type.Sentence

typeDescription.name: org.apache.ctakes.typesystem.type.syntax.SymbolToken
typeDescription.description: Differentiates a token as being a symbol rather than a punctuation, contraction, newline, word, or number. Equivalent to cTAKES: edu.mayo.bmi.uima.core.type.SymbolToken

typeDescription.name: org.apache.ctakes.typesystem.type.refsem.UmlsConcept
typeDescription.description: Concepts in the Unified Medical Language System (UMLS) Metathesaurus have a concept unique identifier (CUI) and a type unique identifier (TUI, i.e., semantic type) which are curated, normalized codes. For example, "pain" would have a cui=C0030193 and tui=T184. Equivalent to cTAKES: edu.mayo.bmi.uima.core.type.UmlsConcept

featureDescription.name: preferredText
featureDescription.description: preferredText is the preferred term. normally his is the UMLS preferred name.

typeDescription.name: org.apache.ctakes.typesystem.type.syntax.Chunk
typeDescription.description: Chunks are syntactic groupings of tokens, and are the results of a shallow parser (chunker). Possible chunkTypes follow Penn Treebank guidelines, e.g., noun phrase (NP) or prepositional phrase (PP) Equivalent to cTAKES: edu.mayo.bmi.uima.chunker.type.Chunk

typeDescription.name: org.apache.ctakes.typesystem.type.syntax.NP
typeDescription.description: A noun phrase Equivalent to cTAKES: edu.mayo.bmi.uima.chunker.type.NP

typeDescription.name: org.apache.ctakes.typesystem.type.syntax.ADJP
typeDescription.description: An adjective phrase Equivalent to cTAKES: edu.mayo.bmi.uima.chunker.type.ADJP

typeDescription.name: org.apache.ctakes.typesystem.type.syntax.ADVP
typeDescription.description: An adverb phrase Equivalent to cTAKES: edu.mayo.bmi.uima.chunker.type.ADVP

typeDescription.name: org.apache.ctakes.typesystem.type.syntax.CONJP
typeDescription.description: A phrase-level conjunction Equivalent to cTAKES: edu.mayo.bmi.uima.chunker.type.CONJP

typeDescription.name: org.apache.ctakes.typesystem.type.syntax.INTJ
typeDescription.description: An interjection Equivalent to cTAKES: edu.mayo.bmi.uima.chunker.type.INTJ

typeDescription.name: org.apache.ctakes.typesystem.type.syntax.LST
typeDescription.description: A list item, usually intra-sentential Equivalent to cTAKES: edu.mayo.bmi.uima.chunker.type.LST

typeDescription.name: org.apache.ctakes.typesystem.type.syntax.PP
typeDescription.description: A prepositional phrase Equivalent to cTAKES: edu.mayo.bmi.uima.chunker.type.PP

typeDescription.name: org.apache.ctakes.typesystem.type.syntax.PRT
typeDescription.description: A particle, e.g., "out" in "rule out" Equivalent to cTAKES: edu.mayo.bmi.uima.chunker.type.PRT

typeDescription.name: org.apache.ctakes.typesystem.type.syntax.SBAR
typeDescription.description: A subordinate clause Equivalent to cTAKES: edu.mayo.bmi.uima.chunker.type.SBAR

typeDescription.name: org.apache.ctakes.typesystem.type.syntax.UCP
typeDescription.description: An unlike coordinating phrase, e.g., a NP and a PP conjoined via "and" Equivalent to cTAKES: edu.mayo.bmi.uima.chunker.type.UCP

typeDescription.name: org.apache.ctakes.typesystem.type.syntax.VP
typeDescription.description: A verb phrase Equivalent to cTAKES: edu.mayo.bmi.uima.chunker.type.VP

typeDescription.name: org.apache.ctakes.typesystem.type.textsem.RomanNumeralAnnotation
typeDescription.description: Equivalent to cTAKES: edu.mayo.bmi.uima.cdt.type.RomanNumeralAnnotation

typeDescription.name: org.apache.ctakes.typesystem.type.textsem.FractionAnnotation
typeDescription.description: Equivalent to cTAKES: edu.mayo.bmi.uima.cdt.type.FractionAnnotation

typeDescription.name: org.apache.ctakes.typesystem.type.textsem.DateAnnotation
typeDescription.description: Equivalent to cTAKES: edu.mayo.bmi.uima.cdt.type.DateAnnotation

typeDescription.name: org.apache.ctakes.typesystem.type.textsem.TimeAnnotation
typeDescription.description: Equivalent to cTAKES: edu.mayo.bmi.uima.cdt.type.TimeAnnotation

typeDescription.name: org.apache.ctakes.typesystem.type.textsem.RangeAnnotation
typeDescription.description: Equivalent to cTAKES: edu.mayo.bmi.uima.cdt.type.RangeAnnotation

typeDescription.name: org.apache.ctakes.typesystem.type.textsem.MeasurementAnnotation
typeDescription.description: Equivalent to cTAKES: edu.mayo.bmi.uima.cdt.type.MeasurementAnnotation

typeDescription.name: org.apache.ctakes.typesystem.type.textsem.PersonTitleAnnotation
typeDescription.description: Equivalent to cTAKES: edu.mayo.bmi.uima.cdt.type.PersonTitleAnnotation

typeDescription.name: org.apache.ctakes.typesystem.type.textsem.ContextAnnotation
typeDescription.description: Contextual information of an entity. Equivalent to cTAKES: edu.mayo.bmi.uima.context.type.ContextAnnotation

typeDescription.name: org.apache.ctakes.typesystem.type.textspan.LookupWindowAnnotation
typeDescription.description: Defines a window within which dictionary terms may match. An auxiliary spanned type. Equivalent to cTAKES: edu.mayo.bmi.uima.lookup.type.LookupWindowAnnotation

typeDescription.name: org.apache.ctakes.typesystem.type.refsem.MedicationRoute
typeDescription.description: Means by which the medication was taken or administered. Value set includes Topical, Enteral_Oral, Parenteral_Intravenous, Other, undetermined, etc.

typeDescription.name: org.apache.ctakes.typesystem.type.refsem.MedicationForm
typeDescription.description: Form of this medication. Value set includes tablet, capsule, liquid, inhalant, gel, other, etc.

typeDescription.name: org.apache.ctakes.typesystem.type.refsem.MedicationStrength
typeDescription.description: Strength indicates the strength number and unit of the prescribed drug. E.g. "5 mg" in "one 5 mg tablet twice-a-day for 2 weeks"

featureDescription.name: unit
featureDescription.description: the unit of measurement

typeDescription.name: org.apache.ctakes.typesystem.type.refsem.MedicationDuration
typeDescription.description: The amount of time after which a medication should stop being used, e.g., "2 weeks" in "one 5 mg tablet twice-a-day for 2 weeks"

typeDescription.name: org.apache.ctakes.typesystem.type.refsem.MedicationDosage
typeDescription.description: Dosage indicates how much of a prescribed drug should be taken. E.g. "one" in "one 5 mg tablet twice-a-day for 2 weeks"

typeDescription.name: org.apache.ctakes.typesystem.type.refsem.MedicationFrequency
typeDescription.description: How often a medication should be used. e.g., BID or b.i.d. or "twice-a-day" would have a number=2 and unit=day.

featureDescription.name: unit
featureDescription.description: The periodic unit used, e.g day, month, hour, etc.

typeDescription.name: org.apache.ctakes.typesystem.type.refsem.MedicationStatusChange
typeDescription.description: Status refers to the whether the medication is currently being taken or not. Value set: start, stop, increase, decrease, no change.

featureDescription.name: value
featureDescription.description: Indicates the change status of 'stop', 'start', 'increase', 'decrease', or 'noChange'.

typeDescription.name: org.apache.ctakes.typesystem.type.refsem.ProcedureDevice
typeDescription.description: Corresponds to the UMLS Devices semantic group: medical device and research device. Example: arterial line has a Medical Device semantic type. This is qualifying information on how a procedure was done.

typeDescription.name: org.apache.ctakes.typesystem.type.refsem.ProcedureMethod
typeDescription.description: The way or the equipment used to give or administration something (medication, test). This corresponds to the Procedures UMLS semantic group. More qualifying information on how the procedure was done.

typeDescription.name: org.apache.ctakes.typesystem.type.refsem.LabDeltaFlag
typeDescription.description: An indicator to warn that the laboratory test result has changed significantly from the previous identical laboratory test result.

typeDescription.name: org.apache.ctakes.typesystem.type.refsem.LabValue
typeDescription.description: Quantitative results of a laboratory, with number and unit.

typeDescription.name: org.apache.ctakes.typesystem.type.refsem.LabReferenceRange
typeDescription.description: Holds a narrative (i.e. string) reference range

typeDescription.name: org.apache.ctakes.typesystem.type.refsem.BodyLaterality
typeDescription.description: The proximity of the location in anatomical terms (distal, proximal, superior, anterior and etc.). This is finer-grained to allow combinations of values.

typeDescription.name: org.apache.ctakes.typesystem.type.refsem.BodySide
typeDescription.description: Value set: unmarked (default), left, right, bilateral

typeDescription.name: org.apache.ctakes.typesystem.type.refsem.Course
typeDescription.description: An indication of progress or decline of a condition. Value set: unmarked (default), changed, increased, decreased, improved, worsened, resolved

typeDescription.name: org.apache.ctakes.typesystem.type.refsem.Severity
typeDescription.description: An explicitly-mentioned indication of the seriousness of a condition. Value Set: unmarked (default), severe, moderate, slight

typeDescription.name: org.apache.ctakes.typesystem.type.refsem.AnatomicalSite
typeDescription.description: A body part or area, corresponding to the UMLS semantic group of Anatomy. An Entity based on generic Clinical Element Models (CEMs)

typeDescription.name: org.apache.ctakes.typesystem.type.refsem.Medication
typeDescription.description: This is an Event from the UMLS semantic group of Chemicals and Drugs, pruned by RxNORM source. Based on generic Clinical Element Models (CEMs)

typeDescription.name: org.apache.ctakes.typesystem.type.refsem.Procedure
typeDescription.description: This is an Event from the UMLS semantic group of Procedures (except that Laboratory procedures are separate). Based on generic Clinical Element Models (CEMs)

typeDescription.name: org.apache.ctakes.typesystem.type.refsem.SignSymptom
typeDescription.description: This is an Event from the UMLS semantic group of Sign or Symtom. Based on generic Clinical Element Models (CEMs)

typeDescription.name: org.apache.ctakes.typesystem.type.refsem.DiseaseDisorder
typeDescription.description: This is an Event from the UMLS semantic group of Disorders (except that Sign and Symptom types are separate). Based on generic Clinical Element Models (CEMs)

typeDescription.name: org.apache.ctakes.typesystem.type.refsem.Lab
typeDescription.description: This is an Event from the UMLS semantic group of Laboratory Procedures. Based on generic Clinical Element Models (CEMs)

typeDescription.name: org.apache.ctakes.typesystem.type.refsem.Element
typeDescription.description: A basic semantic unit that refers to something in the real world, including Entities, Events, Attributes, Dates. Element inherits from uima.cas.TOP to combine textual mentions of these real-world objects.

typeDescription.name: org.apache.ctakes.typesystem.type.refsem.Time
typeDescription.description: A normalized form for Time annotations. Inherits from Element, but some fields may be unused.

typeDescription.name: org.apache.ctakes.typesystem.type.refsem.Date
typeDescription.description: A normalized form for dates, namely with day, month, and year. A subtype of Element but may not use all inherited attributes.

typeDescription.name: org.apache.ctakes.typesystem.type.refsem.Event
typeDescription.description: A real-world event; similar to Entity, but may bear some temporal properties and relationships. In the constrained clinical context, many concepts are discussed as instances with some temporal component, e.g., Medications, Labs.

typeDescription.name: org.apache.ctakes.typesystem.type.refsem.Entity
typeDescription.description: A real-world entity such as a body part. For example, multiple Procedures may have the same AnatomicalSite entity for their locations.

typeDescription.name: org.apache.ctakes.typesystem.type.refsem.Attribute
typeDescription.description: The semantic encapsulation of a modifier. E.g., for Clinical Elements, Attributes may be used to specify Body Side for a Procedure.

typeDescription.name: org.apache.ctakes.typesystem.type.refsem.EventProperties
typeDescription.description: A set of mostly temporal properties that are unique to Events.

featureDescription.name: category
featureDescription.description: Type of Event.

typeDescription.name: org.apache.ctakes.typesystem.type.relation.Relation
typeDescription.description: A superclass for semantic relationships between Elements. For example, one might consider TemporalRelations or UMLSRelations between a Medication and a Disorder. The "category" feature indicates what kind of relation it is.

featureDescription.name: conditional
featureDescription.description: Whether the relation is conditional/hypothetical. Example: "If the patient's tumor returns, we can treat it with Oxaliplatin." This instantiates a manages/treats relation which should be marked as conditional=true, with the "if" marked as the cue.

typeDescription.name: org.apache.ctakes.typesystem.type.relation.RelationArgument
typeDescription.description: Relations are like lines connecting two or more endpoints. RelationArguments are used as endpoints that are text spans via the "argument" feature. The directed relations should specify a "role" feature.

typeDescription.name: org.apache.ctakes.typesystem.type.relation.BinaryTextRelation
typeDescription.description: A super-type for relationships between two spans of text.

featureDescription.name: members
featureDescription.description: A super-type for relationships between multiple spans of text.

typeDescription.name: org.apache.ctakes.typesystem.type.relation.UMLSRelation
typeDescription.description: A biomedical relationship between two spans of text that have been mapped to UMLS concepts. Inherits "category" from Relation, with values such as affects, causes, complicates, contraindicates, degree_of, etc.

typeDescription.name: org.apache.ctakes.typesystem.type.relation.CoreferenceRelation
typeDescription.description: A coreference pair, with antecedent as arg1 and anaphor as arg2

typeDescription.name: org.apache.ctakes.typesystem.type.relation.ElementRelation
typeDescription.description: A super-type referring to real-world semantic relationships, e.g., TemporalRelations between two Events.

typeDescription.name: org.apache.ctakes.typesystem.type.relation.AttributeRelation
typeDescription.description: A real-world relationship between an Element and an Attribute.

typeDescription.name: org.apache.ctakes.typesystem.type.relation.TemporalRelation
typeDescription.description: Based on ISO TimeML's TLINK.

typeDescription.name: org.apache.ctakes.typesystem.type.relation.Affects
typeDescription.description: A UMLS relation between clinical elements.

typeDescription.name: org.apache.ctakes.typesystem.type.relation.ResultOf
typeDescription.description: A UMLS relation between clinical elements.

typeDescription.name: org.apache.ctakes.typesystem.type.relation.ManifestationOf
typeDescription.description: A UMLS relation between clinical elements.

typeDescription.name: org.apache.ctakes.typesystem.type.relation.LocationOf
typeDescription.description: A UMLS relation between clinical elements.

typeDescription.name: org.apache.ctakes.typesystem.type.relation.DegreeOf
typeDescription.description: A UMLS relation between an attribute and an entity/event.

typeDescription.name: org.apache.ctakes.typesystem.type.relation.AspectualTextRelation
typeDescription.description: A UMLS relation between clinical elements.

typeDescription.name: org.apache.ctakes.typesystem.type.relation.TemporalTextRelation
typeDescription.description: A UMLS relation between clinical elements.

typeDescription.name: org.apache.ctakes.typesystem.type.structured.Demographics
typeDescription.description: Demographic information about the patient in a clinical document. Typically comes from structured metadata.

typeDescription.name: org.apache.ctakes.typesystem.type.structured.SourceData
typeDescription.description: Information about the caregiving setting for the clinical document. Typically comes from structured metadata.

typeDescription.name: org.apache.ctakes.typesystem.type.structured.Metadata
typeDescription.description: Structured data that captures information about the document, patient, or context of the clinical text.

typeDescription.name: org.apache.ctakes.typesystem.type.syntax.TreebankNode
typeDescription.description: A Penn Treebank-style tree node. Conforms to PTB 2.0 guidelines.

featureDescription.name: headIndex
featureDescription.description: The head index tracks the index into the word tokens which is the syntactic head of a phrase.

typeDescription.name: org.apache.ctakes.typesystem.type.syntax.TerminalTreebankNode
typeDescription.description: A Penn Treebank Node; as a terminal, there is an associated word, and the index of the word is a feature.

featureDescription.name: index
featureDescription.description: The index of this node in the top node's list of terminals.

featureDescription.name: tokenIndex
featureDescription.description: The tokenIndex of a terminal is n, where the terminal is the nth token in a sentence. The value -1 means that this terminal does not correspond to a token (because it is a trace.) We assume that each token corresponds to a terminal.

typeDescription.name: org.apache.ctakes.typesystem.type.syntax.TopTreebankNode
typeDescription.description: A Penn Treebank Node; as the top node, this stores the whole subsumed sentence's parse tree as a string. It also stores all the terminals, allowing for traversal of the tree bottom-up (top-down is implied through the TreebankNode's 'children' attribute).

featureDescription.name: treebankParse
featureDescription.description: A bracketed sentence string representing the parse tree.

featureDescription.name: terminals
featureDescription.description: Stores the terminal nodes of the parse tree. This allows for bottom-up traversal of a tree.

typeDescription.name: org.apache.ctakes.typesystem.type.syntax.ConllDependencyNode
typeDescription.description: A dependency parser node in the CONLL-X format, namely, where each node is a token with 10 fields.

featureDescription.name: id
featureDescription.description: The token's position in the sentence. The ROOT node, present in every dependency parse, has id=0.

typeDescription.name: org.apache.ctakes.typesystem.type.syntax.StanfordDependency
typeDescription.description: Stanford dependencies provide a representation of grammatical relations between words in a sentence. Stanford dependencies are triplets: name of the relation, governor and dependent.

typeDescription.name: org.apache.ctakes.typesystem.type.textsem.IdentifiedAnnotation
typeDescription.description: Any span of text that has been discovered or flagged for some reason, such as a Named Entity. Allows for mapping to an ontology. Generalized from cTAKES: org.apache.ctakes.typesystem.type.IdentifiedAnnotation.

featureDescription.name: typeID
featureDescription.description: The type of named entity (e.g. drug, disorder, ...)

featureDescription.name: sentenceID
featureDescription.description: contains the sentence id of the sentence that contains the NE's text span

featureDescription.name: confidence
featureDescription.description: The confidence of the annotation.

featureDescription.name: originalText
featureDescription.description: The covered text of the span or the disjoint spans that resulted in the creation of this IdentifiedAnnotation. If the covered text is from disjoint spans, they are separated by a delimiter.

typeDescription.name: org.apache.ctakes.typesystem.type.temporary.assertion.AssertionCuePhraseAnnotation
typeDescription.description: A cue phrase indicating potential negation, uncertainty, or conditional

featureDescription.name: cuePhraseAssertionFamily
featureDescription.description: which assertion family this cue phrase belongs to (negation, uncertainty, or conditional)

featureDescription.name: cuePhraseFirstWord
featureDescription.description: first word of cue phrase

featureDescription.name: cuePhrase
featureDescription.description: cue phrase itself (from lookup list)

typeDescription.name: org.apache.ctakes.typesystem.type.textsem.EntityMention
typeDescription.description: A text string (IdentifiedAnnotation) that refers to an Entity.

typeDescription.name: org.apache.ctakes.typesystem.type.textsem.EventMention
typeDescription.description: A text string (IdentifiedAnnotation) that refers to an Event.

typeDescription.name: org.apache.ctakes.typesystem.type.textsem.MedicationEventMention
typeDescription.description: As of cTAKEs 3.1, see org.apache.ctakes.typesystem.type.textsem.MedicationMention.

typeDescription.name: org.apache.ctakes.typesystem.type.textsem.TimeMention
typeDescription.description: A text string (IdentifiedAnnotation) that refers to a Time (i.e., TIMEX3).

featureDescription.name: timeClass
featureDescription.description: DATE, DURATION, QUANTIFIER, PREPOSTEXP, etc.

typeDescription.name: org.apache.ctakes.typesystem.type.textsem.Modifier
typeDescription.description: A text string (IdentifiedAnnotation) that refers to an Attribute.

typeDescription.name: org.apache.ctakes.typesystem.type.textsem.Predicate
typeDescription.description: Predicates are typically verbs and may participate in SemanticRoleRelations. Follows PropBank standards with a few clinical additions.

typeDescription.name: org.apache.ctakes.typesystem.type.textsem.SemanticArgument
typeDescription.description: SemanticArguments are used for predicate-argument structures (SemanticRoleRelations). The "label" features should contain the type of semantic role (e.g., ARG0, ARGM) that this argument has w.r.t. the predicate.

typeDescription.name: org.apache.ctakes.typesystem.type.textsem.SemanticRoleRelation
typeDescription.description: Predicate-argument structure used for semantic role labeling output.

typeDescription.name: org.apache.ctakes.typesystem.type.textspan.Paragraph
typeDescription.description: A text span corresponding to a paragraph, typically containing multiple sentences.

typeDescription.name: org.apache.ctakes.typesystem.type.textspan.List
typeDescription.description: A semi-structured text span, containing other Annotations (typically Sentences, other Lists, etc).

typeDescription.name: org.apache.ctakes.typesystem.type.textspan.ListEntry
typeDescription.description: A text span corresponding to a list entry, typically a single line in a multiline List.

typeDescription.name: org.apache.ctakes.typesystem.type.util.Pair
typeDescription.description: An Attribute-Value tuple. Equivalent to cTAKES: edu.mayo.bmi.uima.core.type.Property

typeDescription.name: org.apache.ctakes.typesystem.type.util.Pairs
typeDescription.description: A brute force "hash" that stores multiple Pairs in a list. Equivalent to cTAKES: edu.mayo.bmi.uima.core.type.Properties

typeDescription.name: org.apache.ctakes.typesystem.type.util.ProbabilityDistribution
typeDescription.description: A brute force probability distribution for discrete variables.

typeDescription.name: org.apache.ctakes.typesystem.type.textspan.LookupWindowAnnotation
typeDescription.description: Defines a window within which dictionary terms may match. An auxiliary spanned type. Equivalent to cTAKES: edu.mayo.bmi.uima.lookup.type.LookupWindowAnnotation

typeDescription.name: org.apache.ctakes.typesystem.type.refsem.MedicationRoute
typeDescription.description: Means by which the medication was taken or administered. Value set includes Topical, Enteral_Oral, Parenteral_Intravenous, Other, undetermined, etc.

typeDescription.name: org.apache.ctakes.typesystem.type.refsem.MedicationForm
typeDescription.description: Form of this medication. Value set includes tablet, capsule, liquid, inhalant, gel, other, etc.

typeDescription.name: org.apache.ctakes.typesystem.type.refsem.MedicationStrength
typeDescription.description: Strength indicates the strength number and unit of the prescribed drug. E.g. "5 mg" in "one 5 mg tablet twice-a-day for 2 weeks"

featureDescription.name: unit
featureDescription.description: the unit of measurement

typeDescription.name: org.apache.ctakes.typesystem.type.refsem.MedicationDuration
typeDescription.description: The amount of time after which a medication should stop being used, e.g., "2 weeks" in "one 5 mg tablet twice-a-day for 2 weeks"

typeDescription.name: org.apache.ctakes.typesystem.type.refsem.MedicationDosage
typeDescription.description: Dosage indicates how much of a prescribed drug should be taken. E.g. "one" in "one 5 mg tablet twice-a-day for 2 weeks"

typeDescription.name: org.apache.ctakes.typesystem.type.refsem.MedicationFrequency
typeDescription.description: How often a medication should be used. e.g., BID or b.i.d. or "twice-a-day" would have a number=2 and unit=day.

featureDescription.name: unit
featureDescription.description: The periodic unit used, e.g day, month, hour, etc.

typeDescription.name: org.apache.ctakes.typesystem.type.refsem.MedicationStatusChange
typeDescription.description: Status refers to the whether the medication is currently being taken or not. Value set: start, stop, increase, decrease, no change.

featureDescription.name: value
featureDescription.description: Indicates the change status of 'stop', 'start', 'increase', 'decrease', or 'noChange'.

typeDescription.name: org.apache.ctakes.typesystem.type.refsem.ProcedureDevice
typeDescription.description: Corresponds to the UMLS Devices semantic group: medical device and research device. Example: arterial line has a Medical Device semantic type. This is qualifying information on how a procedure was done.

typeDescription.name: org.apache.ctakes.typesystem.type.refsem.ProcedureMethod
typeDescription.description: The way or the equipment used to give or administration something (medication, test). This corresponds to the Procedures UMLS semantic group. More qualifying information on how the procedure was done.

typeDescription.name: org.apache.ctakes.typesystem.type.refsem.LabDeltaFlag
typeDescription.description: An indicator to warn that the laboratory test result has changed significantly from the previous identical laboratory test result.

typeDescription.name: org.apache.ctakes.typesystem.type.refsem.LabValue
typeDescription.description: Quantitative results of a laboratory, with number and unit.

typeDescription.name: org.apache.ctakes.typesystem.type.refsem.LabReferenceRange
typeDescription.description: Holds a narrative (i.e. string) reference range

typeDescription.name: org.apache.ctakes.typesystem.type.refsem.BodyLaterality
typeDescription.description: The proximity of the location in anatomical terms (distal, proximal, superior, anterior and etc.). This is finer-grained to allow combinations of values.

typeDescription.name: org.apache.ctakes.typesystem.type.refsem.BodySide
typeDescription.description: Value set: unmarked (default), left, right, bilateral

typeDescription.name: org.apache.ctakes.typesystem.type.refsem.Course
typeDescription.description: An indication of progress or decline of a condition. Value set: unmarked (default), changed, increased, decreased, improved, worsened, resolved

typeDescription.name: org.apache.ctakes.typesystem.type.refsem.Severity
typeDescription.description: An explicitly-mentioned indication of the seriousness of a condition. Value Set: unmarked (default), severe, moderate, slight

typeDescription.name: org.apache.ctakes.typesystem.type.textsem.MedicationRouteModifier
typeDescription.description: Means by which the medication was taken or administered. Value set includes Topical, Enteral_Oral, Parenteral_Intravenous, Other, undetermined, etc.

typeDescription.name: org.apache.ctakes.typesystem.type.textsem.MedicationFormModifier
typeDescription.description: Form of this medication. Value set includes tablet, capsule, liquid, inhalant, gel, other, etc.

typeDescription.name: org.apache.ctakes.typesystem.type.textsem.MedicationStrengthModifier
typeDescription.description: Strength indicates the strength number and unit of the prescribed drug. E.g. "5 mg" in "one 5 mg tablet twice-a-day for 2 weeks"

typeDescription.name: org.apache.ctakes.typesystem.type.textsem.MedicationDurationModifier
typeDescription.description: The amount of time after which a medication should stop being used, e.g., "2 weeks" in "one 5 mg tablet twice-a-day for 2 weeks"

typeDescription.name: org.apache.ctakes.typesystem.type.textsem.MedicationDosageModifier
typeDescription.description: Dosage indicates how much of a prescribed drug should be taken. E.g. "one" in "one 5 mg tablet twice-a-day for 2 weeks"

typeDescription.name: org.apache.ctakes.typesystem.type.textsem.MedicationFrequencyModifier
typeDescription.description: How often a medication should be used. e.g., BID or b.i.d. or "twice-a-day" would have a number=2 and unit=day.

typeDescription.name: org.apache.ctakes.typesystem.type.textsem.MedicationStatusChangeModifier
typeDescription.description: Status refers to the whether the medication is currently being taken or not. Value set: start, stop, increase, decrease, no change.

typeDescription.name: org.apache.ctakes.typesystem.type.textsem.ProcedureDeviceModifier
typeDescription.description: Corresponds to the UMLS Devices semantic group: medical device and research device. Example: arterial line has a Medical Device semantic type. This is qualifying information on how a procedure was done.

typeDescription.name: org.apache.ctakes.typesystem.type.textsem.ProcedureMethodModifier
typeDescription.description: The way or the equipment used to give or administration something (medication, test). This corresponds to the Procedures UMLS semantic group. More qualifying information on how the procedure was done.

typeDescription.name: org.apache.ctakes.typesystem.type.textsem.LabDeltaFlagModifier
typeDescription.description: An indicator to warn that the laboratory test result has changed significantly from the previous identical laboratory test result.

typeDescription.name: org.apache.ctakes.typesystem.type.textsem.LabValueModifier
typeDescription.description: Quantitative results of a laboratory, with number and unit.

typeDescription.name: org.apache.ctakes.typesystem.type.textsem.LabReferenceRangeModifier
typeDescription.description: Holds a narrative (i.e. string) reference range

typeDescription.name: org.apache.ctakes.typesystem.type.textsem.BodyLateralityModifier
typeDescription.description: The proximity of the location in anatomical terms (distal, proximal, superior, anterior and etc.). This is finer-grained to allow combinations of values.

typeDescription.name: org.apache.ctakes.typesystem.type.textsem.BodySideModifier
typeDescription.description: Value set: unmarked (default), left, right, bilateral

typeDescription.name: org.apache.ctakes.typesystem.type.textsem.CourseModifier
typeDescription.description: An indication of progress or decline of a condition. Value set: unmarked (default), changed, increased, decreased, improved, worsened, resolved

typeDescription.name: org.apache.ctakes.typesystem.type.textsem.SeverityModifier
typeDescription.description: An explicitly-mentioned indication of the seriousness of a condition. Value Set: unmarked (default), severe, moderate, slight

typeDescription.name: org.apache.ctakes.typesystem.type.textsem.PolarityModifier
typeDescription.description: Used to indicate that a procedure or assertion did not occur or does not exist. If indicated, negation is present and polarity should be -1. If not indicated, negation is not present and polarity should be +1 by default.

typeDescription.name: org.apache.ctakes.typesystem.type.textsem.ConditionalModifier
typeDescription.description: The Conditional modifier refers to mentions which could exist under certain circumstances. If indicated, there are conditions under which an associated Named Entity mention might not be truly asserted.

typeDescription.name: org.apache.ctakes.typesystem.type.textsem.UncertaintyModifier
typeDescription.description: An introduction of a measure of doubt into a statement. If indicated, there is uncertainty.

typeDescription.name: org.apache.ctakes.typesystem.type.textsem.GenericModifier
typeDescription.description: The Generic modifier indicates that a named entity mention is generic, i.e., not related to the instance of a disorder, sign/symptom, etc.

typeDescription.name: org.apache.ctakes.typesystem.type.textsem.SubjectModifier
typeDescription.description: The person the observation is on, i.e., a Person mention. This modifier refers to the entity experiencing the disorder.

typeDescription.name: org.apache.ctakes.typesystem.type.textsem.HistoryOfModifier
typeDescription.description: An indication of explicit mentioning of a past history. The indicator captures only very explicit mentions of historicity.

typeDescription.name: org.apache.ctakes.typesystem.type.textsem.LabInterpretationModifier
typeDescription.description: Test result interpretations organized in a valued list e.g., "rare cells seen" or "few cells seen" in urinalysis, now combined with very_abnormal and abnormal.

typeDescription.name: org.apache.ctakes.typesystem.type.textsem.MedicationAllergyModifier
typeDescription.description: Indication of whether the medication is mentioned in the context of Allergies.

typeDescription.name: org.apache.ctakes.typesystem.type.textsem.LabEstimatedModifier
typeDescription.description: Signals that the lab value was estimated, e.g., "GFR (estimated): 81". True means that there is an indicator signalling that there was an estimation of the value.

typeDescription.name: org.apache.ctakes.typesystem.type.textsem.AnatomicalSiteMention
typeDescription.description: A text string that refers to a (AnatomicalSite) Entity. A body part or area, corresponding to the UMLS semantic group of Anatomy. Based on generic Clinical Element Models (CEMs)

typeDescription.name: org.apache.ctakes.typesystem.type.textsem.MedicationMention
typeDescription.description: A text string that refers to a (Medication) Event. This is an Event from the UMLS semantic group of Chemicals and Drugs, pruned by RxNORM source. Based on generic Clinical Element Models (CEMs)

typeDescription.name: org.apache.ctakes.typesystem.type.textsem.ProcedureMention
typeDescription.description: A text string that refers to a (Procedure) Event. This is from the UMLS semantic group of Procedures (except that Laboratory procedures are separate). Based on generic Clinical Element Models (CEMs)

typeDescription.name: org.apache.ctakes.typesystem.type.textsem.SignSymptomMention
typeDescription.description: A text string that refers to a (SignSymptom) Event. This is from the UMLS semantic group of Sign or Symtom. Based on generic Clinical Element Models (CEMs)

typeDescription.name: org.apache.ctakes.typesystem.type.textsem.DiseaseDisorderMention
typeDescription.description: A text string that refers to a (DiseaseDisorder) Event. This is from the UMLS semantic group of Disorders (except that Sign and Symptom types are separate). Based on generic Clinical Element Models (CEMs)

typeDescription.name: org.apache.ctakes.typesystem.type.textsem.LabMention
typeDescription.description: A text string that refers to a (Lab) Event. This is from the UMLS semantic group of Laboratory Procedures. Based on generic Clinical Element Models (CEMs)

typeDescription.name: org.apache.ctakes.typesystem.type.textsem.Markable
typeDescription.description: A type for representing text spans that can potentially be linked together via coreference.

typeDescription.name: org.apache.ctakes.typesystem.type.relation.CollectionTextRelationIdentifiedAnnotationRelation
typeDescription.description: A relation between a chain relation and an identified annotation mention. Useful for relating a new mention to a collection of previous mentions, e.g., in coreference resolution.
